intro: Neodryas densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on various host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. It has small, opposite leaves and produces white or pale yellow flowers that are often clustered together. The plant relies on its host for water and nutrients, while still performing some photosynthesis. Its berries are typically red or orange and serve as a food source for birds and other animals. Neodryas densiflora plays a role in ecological interactions, contributing to seed dispersal and providing habitat for various organisms.
